abstract: United States Military says Black Hawk helicopter that crashed in March off Florida coast, killing 11 servicemen during training exercise, was due to pilot disorientation while switching from visual to instrument-based procedures amid thick fog.
lead_paragraph: A Black Hawk helicopter crashed in March off the Florida coast because two veteran pilots became disoriented and lost control while switching from visual to instrument-based flight procedures in a thick fog, the military said.

headline.main: Florida: Pilot Disorientation Blamed in Deaths
headline.print_headline: Florida: Pilot Disorientation Blamed in Deaths

snippet: A Black Hawk helicopter crashed in March off the Florida coast because two veteran pilots became disoriented and lost control while switching from visual to instrument-based flight procedures in a thick fog, the military said.
